meanings.definition: To make or become Japanese in character or style.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys japanizing her artwork with traditional Japanese motifs.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant decided to japanize its menu by adding sushi and ramen dishes.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be japanizing itself by sitting in a zen-like pose.
meanings.sent4: The garden was japanizing under the influence of the cherry blossom tree.
meanings.sent5: The kimono's intricate design truly japanized the outfit.

meanings.definition: To adapt or conform to Japanese customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: He is slowly japanizing to the local culture by learning the language.
meanings.sent2: The foreign exchange student was japanizing quickly to the school's traditions.
meanings.sent3: The robot was japanizing to the tea ceremony, pouring tea with precision.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was japanizing, incorporating elements of kimonos and obis.
meanings.sent5: The company was japanizing its business model to cater to the Japanese market.
